Patton against Page. a mortgagee impelled, 5« order to get hold of the mortgaged subject, to go i,lU’ KI“ :ir' count ot' Unpersonal =•:- SCt3' THERE was a decree in this case in the Court below, to foreclose a mortgage against the devisee of the mortgarmr p lm Mr. Bolts moved for an appeal,

upon the ground that ° - . . ... , tile personal representative should have been a defendant, in order that he might have accounted for the personal assets.

*450 By the Chancellor.

The mortgagee cannot be compelled, in order to get hold of the mortgaged subject, to go into an account of the assets: it would be against the constant course of the Court; and again, the decree is but interlocutory.

Appeal denied.
